---

## Ubuntu Installation

- Create a live Ubuntu USB using [Ubuntu ISO](https://ubuntu.com/download/desktop) and [Etcher](https://etcher.balena.io/)
- Plug the live USB and the empty drive into the Steam Deck.
- Hold the volume button and power button to boot into the USB.
- Pick Try Ubuntu.
- Start the installer.
- Select Interactive installation.
- Delete the old drive (click the â€“ icon).
![Image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/12553570/517240505-a521414a-9974-4f70-aaa5-0ed9e971f765.jpg?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..iz3EmAfrUzeLWIxwuW5VIUiS5umzmt_35NGysw25eZk)

- Create a new one and set the mount point to /. The boot partition will be created for you.
![Image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/12553570/517244427-2086a79e-8cc2-4ecf-9b56-b32231ac9340.jpg?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..CMiOHjKnSnfTz0lNZu9MdkBvbz63o8WAu0E2EboHYy4)
- Review the summary. Other drives should stay unchanged
![Image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/12553570/517244513-72c5c166-2dd3-4bab-a4e7-715e697a951b.jpg?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..ffONqxz00OTAAqcnOf4syVyRTB8TAe7yy_2nlv6wMz4)
